content.question: A recent study reported that <math alttext="45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of adults in the United States now get all their news online. A random sample of <math alttext="8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adults in the United States will be selected. What is the probability that <math alttext="6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> of the selected adults get all their news online?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 choose 2, times 0.45 to the eighth power times 0.55 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.45</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.55</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
